sentences.sContent: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was not the arid place it is now. Rather, it was warm and damp, populated by dense primordial forest.
sentences.sCn: 2000万年前，爱达荷州不像现在这样干旱。确切地说，它那时温暖潮湿，生长着茂密的原始森林。

trans.tranCn: 相当； 有点儿； 宁愿， 宁可； 更确切地说
trans.tranOther: You use rather when you are correcting something that you have just said, especially when you are describing a particular situation after saying what it is not
